anyCallInputParameters.description: Input parameters of the service call.

cliniciansResult.description: Patient's clinicians. All of them not limited by start/end dates.

comment.description: Concluding comments are created by a physician when referring a patient to another physician. For this purpose the physician summarizes further necessary resp. recommended actions, e.g. the patient should lessen steroid intake or the patient should be referred to a radiologist for an MRI-scan. Concluding comments have an author (creator), distinct addressee (either name and role of medical professional or only role of medical professional)
comment.title: The Comment Schema

diseasesResult.description: Patient's diseases. Not limited by start-end dates

followUpsResult.description: All follow ups from future should be shown (still to be clarified with clinicians). Follow-up appointments are appointments where patients were asked by a physician to consult another specific/type of physician for a follow-up treatment, e.g., see a radiologist to get an MRI or see Dr. Schmidt, cardiologist at UDUS, to get an ECG. It could be also that the patient shall make a follow-up appointment with the secretary of the physician him-/herself. Follow-up appointments will be defined in the Narratives Manager with a specified time range until a follow-up appointment should be arranged.

createdDate.description: Date when clinician creates the follow up.
createdDate.title: The Date Schema

patientUpdatedDate.description: Date when patient updates the follow up with required data.
patientUpdatedDate.title: The Date Schema

followUpDate.description: Planned date of the follow up.
followUpDate.title: The Date Schema

note.default: See the Cardiologist in next 2 weeks
note.title: The Note Schema

observationResult.description: different patient measurements. On this CM graph only measurements and recordings will be depicted as stored for a specific patient. The following data types are generally available and shall be presented in line graphs:Blood pressure, Heart rate, Weight, Steps, Walking distance, Night sleep, Pain ratings, Well-being ratings, EQ-5D, RADAI, FFbh, HAQ

source.description: Source of measurement if it is the same for all values of this measurement

id.description: enumarator for trial 1, should be any new measurement type in future
id.title: The Id Schema

maxValue.description: Expected max value defined in Narrative Manager for the specific patient
maxValue.title: The Maxvalue Schema

minValue.description: Expected min value defined in Narrative Manager for the specific patient
minValue.title: The Minvalue Schema

name.description: Observation name as it will appear in a graph
name.title: The Name Schema

helpText.description: Help text to explain values meaning (e.g. for different scores)
helpText.title: The HelpText Schema

unit.description: Observation unit in which measurements are made as these appear in a graph
unit.title: The Unit Schema

source.description: Source of a single measurement if measurements from different sources are combined

medicationIntakesResult.description: Presentation of patientâ€™s recordings on drug intake when differing from their defined medication: Differing medication intake as recorded on the Patient Dashboard.
